title: 1982–83 Kent Football League
text:
The 1982–83 Kent Football League season was the 17th in the history of the <a href="Kent%20Football%20League">Kent Football League</a>, a <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition in England. This season was the last with two points for a win system.
The league was won by <a href="Crockenhill%20F.C.">Crockenhill</a>, while <a href="Chatham%20Town%20F.C.">Chatham Town</a> was promoted to the <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern Football League</a>.
League Table.
The league featured 15 clubs which competed in the previous season, along with two new clubs, transferred from the <a href="London%20Spartan%20League">London Spartan League</a>:
